title: OXO Beak Ice Cream Scoop
description: Hard packed ice cream has met its match with this OXO Good Grips Beak Ice Cream Scoop. The unique aluminum beak shape has a thin tip to break into hard ice cream, curved side edges to roll perfectly round scoops and large capacity to satisfy big appetites. While our Beak Ice Cream Scoop has non-stick coating for easy release, for extra sticky ice cream try the ejector button and watch ice cream glide off the Beak Ice Cream Scoop and into your bowl. Even soft ice cream and yogurt ends up in your bowl, not sticking to the Scoop. The Beak Ice Cream Scoop’s flat back is great for both round and square ice cream containers. Enjoy our contoured non-slip handle to cushion your hand as you scoop.

Hard packed ice cream has met its match with this OXO Good Grips Beak Ice Cream Scoop. The unique aluminum beak shape has a thin tip to break into hard ice cream, curved side edges to roll perfectly round scoops and large capacity to satisfy big appetites. While our Beak Ice Cream Scoop has non-stick coating for easy release, for extra sticky ice cream try the ejector button and watch ice cream glide off the Beak Ice Cream Scoop and into your bowl. Even soft ice cream and yogurt ends up in your bowl, not sticking to the Scoop. The Beak Ice Cream Scoop’s flat back is great for both round and square ice cream containers. transcripts: Whether you’re a die hard Rocky Road fan or swear by salted caramel we realized that everyone has a favorite sweet treat and also a favorite way of scooping it, so we make many different scoops in all different shapes and sizes. Hand packed ice cream has met its match with this OXO ice cream, the unique aluminum beak shape has a thin tip to break into hard ice cream curved side edges to roll perfectly round scoops and large capacity to satisfy big appetites. The scoops flat back is great for both round and square ice cream containers. Use our non-slip contoured handle to cushion your hand while you scoop. For extra sticky ice cream try the ejector button and watch ice cream glide off the scoop and into your bowl even soft ice cream and yogurt ends up in your bowl not sticking to the scoop,  we don't recommend putting the scoop in the dishwasher, hand wash only please. Here’s a good tip to prevent ice crystals from forming on your ice cream cover the surface with a layer of plastic wrap or wax paper before closing the container.
